comments:
Hi,

I have been using Eclipse 3.1 without any problem. Now I need to use xalan.jar
in my program. When I add this to the path of the JRE, Eclipse does not start
and gives the following exception.

Any ideas how I can solve this problem?

!SESSION Oct 07, 2004 09:41:56.968 ---------------------------------------------

Dear Sir,

Before I start the Eclipse and run the code I need to put the xalan.jar into the
"C:\Program Files\Java\j2re1.5.0\lib\ext" directory. Otherwise the import
statement cannot find the jar file. However, if I put the xalan.jar in this
directory Eclipse does not start and says "An error has occured. See the log
file C:\Workspace\.metadata\.log." As a result of this, I couldn't have chance
top run your sample code.

I am not very good in Java but if I am not wrong I need to put the jar files in
the path of the JRE. Isn't that correct? This is why I got stucked.

Created an attachment (id=15348)
compiled version of the test program

I was not suggesting you to run Eclipse to run that program, but rather run
that code from the command line, using only Java. i realize now you only have
the JRE, so you could not compile it. This is why I am attaching the .class
instead.  To run it:
1) save the attached .class file somewhere in your disk (e.g. c:\temp)
2) open the command line prompt
3) cd into the directory where you saved the .class file
4) run:
  C:\Program Files\Java\j2re1.5.0\jre\bin\java Main

What is the output?

>if I am not wrong I need to put the jar files in
>the path of the JRE. Isn't that correct? This is 
>why I got stucked.

Only if you are not developing plug-ins, but regular Java applications.
Otherwise, I would recommend not adding xalan to the JRE and instead create a
wrapper plug-in that provides xalan so you can use it in your own plug-ins.

You don't need to compile. Please use the class file in attachment 15348. To do
so, just follow the steps in comment 5.

Dear Rafael,

I realised that there are three different versions of the xalan.jar in my
computer that I have downloaded from the web. When I copied the right one into
the directory of the JRE, Eclipse started without any problem.

Thanks very much for your help. I really appreciate this.

Regards,
Ali
Ok, thanks for the follow up.
